New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning to give the Dodgers a 6-3 victory.
Giancarlo Stanton launched a two-run homer for the Yankees.
Anthony Volpe grounded into a fielder's choice to score Jazz Chisholm Jr. in the top of the 10th inning.
Shohei Ohtani scored on a sacrifice fly by Mookie Betts to tie the game 2-all in the 8th inning.
Aaron Judge struck out swinging in his first three at-bats before hitting a single in the 7th inning.
Gavin Lux walked and advanced to second on an infield single in the bottom of the 10th inning.
Alex Verdugo made a running catch in foul territory, advancing both runners one base.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts marveled at Freeman's grand slam, calling it the greatest baseball moment he has ever witnessed.
Freddie Freeman expressed disbelief and joy over his game-winning hit, dedicating the moment to his father.
Yankees slugger Aaron Judge emphasized the need to learn from the loss and improve for the next game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the 12th time the Yankees and Dodgers are meeting in the World Series, the most frequent matchup in major league history.
Fernando Valenzuela, the 1981 NL Cy Young Award winner and Rookie of the Year, was honored with a moment of silence before the game.
